action.action-desc: Ms. Tlaib (for herself, Ms. DeLauro, Mr. Frost, Ms. Kelly of Illinois, Ms. Brownley, Mr. Case, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, Mr. Courtney, Mr. Davis of Illinois, Mr. DeSaulnier, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Ms. Lee of Pennsylvania, Mr. Lieu, Mr. Lynch, Mrs. McIver, Ms. Norton, Mrs. Ramirez, Ms. Ross, Ms. Salinas, Ms. Schakowsky, Ms. Simon, Ms. Stansbury, Mrs. Sykes, Mr. Thanedar, Ms. Tokuda, Mr. Torres of New York, Ms. Underwood, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Ms. Dean of Pennsylvania, and Mrs. Hayes) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to require a gun lock to be provided to every firearm purchaser.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safe Storage Saves Lives Act.

section.header: Requirement that a compatible gun lock be provided to every firearm purchaser
section.text: Section 922(z) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking handgun each place it appears and inserting firearm;

subparagraph.text: by striking licensed importer, licensed manufacturer, or licensed dealer and inserting person;
by striking person other than any person licensed under this chapter and inserting other person; and
by striking for that and inserting compatible with the; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)(D), by striking licensed manufacturer, licensed importer, or licensed dealer and inserting transferor.

section.header: Clarification of definition of secure gun storage or safety device
section.text: Section 921(a)(34)(C) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting provided with, or incorporated into the design of, the device before the period.

section.header: Requirement that a gun seller have a compatible gun lock available for every firearm offered for sale

subsection.text: Section 922(z) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Requirement that a gun seller have a compatible gun lock available for every firearm offered for sale
paragraph.text: It shall be unlawful for any person to offer a firearm for sale unless the person offers for sale a secure gun storage or safety device that is compatible with the firearm.
Section 924(p) of such title is amended by adding at the end the following:

With respect to each violation of section 922(z)(4) by a person who is not a licensed importer, licensed manufacturer, or licensed dealer, the Attorney General may, after notice and opportunity for hearing, subject the violator to a civil penalty of not more than $1,000.
Section 924(p)(1) of such title is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking In general and inserting Penalties on licensed manufacturers, licensed importers, and licensed dealers; and
in subparagraph (A), by striking Secretary and inserting Attorney General.

section.text: It is the sense of the Congress that any funds collected through fines for violations of section 922(z)(4) of title 18, United States Code, be used for the distribution of free or reduced-cost secure gun storage or safety devices, or for a campaign to raise public awareness about the use of the devices.
